metadata.title: How to Set Up YouTube Channel Memberships 2025: Complete Guide
metadata.description: Launch YouTube Memberships. Pricing strategies, perks, and retention tactics for creators.

hero.headline: How to Set Up YouTube Memberships
hero.subheadline: Create recurring revenue with channel memberships. Strategy and setup guide.

sections.content: YouTube Memberships let your biggest fans support you monthly in exchange for exclusive perks. It's recurring revenue that doesn't depend on views. But success requires strategy—the right price points, valuable perks, and consistent delivery. Here's how to launch and grow memberships.

content.title: 1,000 Subscribers
content.description: Minimum threshold for eligibility. Same as monetization.

content.title: Good Standing
content.description: No community strikes. Active monetization enabled.

content.title: Available Location
content.description: Not available in all countries. Check eligibility in Studio.

content.title: Early Access
content.description: Members see videos first. Easy to deliver, highly valued.

content.title: Members-Only Posts
content.description: Exclusive Community Tab content. Behind-the-scenes, polls.

content.title: Discord Access
content.description: Private community. Direct interaction. Strong retention perk.

sections.title: Pricing Strategy
content: Start with 2-3 tiers, add more later
Don't promise what you can't deliver

faq.question: What percentage does YouTube take?
faq.answer: YouTube takes 30% of membership revenue. Plan pricing accordingly. Still better than most platforms.

faq.question: How many tiers should I have?
faq.answer: Start with 2-3 tiers. Too many confuses people. Most members join lowest or second tier regardless of options.

faq.question: Best perks for retention?
faq.answer: Community access (Discord) has highest retention. Early access is easy. Behind-the-scenes is popular. Avoid perks requiring individual attention at scale.

faq.question: How to promote memberships?
faq.answer: Dedicated announcement video. Regular reminders in videos (not annoying). Shoutouts to members. Show member benefits in action.
